translated: One will accomplish the sword, the swift feet, the pill, the yaká¹£iá¹‡Ä«, the cave of the asura, the eye medicine, treasure, and invisibility.

original: chu klung gi nang du mgrin pa man chad nub par zhugs nas gza' phur bu'i zhag la stong phrag nyi shu rtsa brgyad bzlas na sa 'og dang sa steng dang sa bla gsum las rnam par rgyal bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Having entered into the water of a river up to oneâ€™s neck, one should repeat [the mantra] twenty-eight thousand times on a day of [the planet] Bá¹›haspati. One will be victorious over the three worlds, the underworld, the earth, and the heavens.

translated: Having performed the preliminary practice as previously described,

translated: Then, having taken the smoke and well placed it in a box,

translated: one should bind it with a five-colored thread in the form of a cross.

analyzed: snga ma ltar bsnyen pa byas la bhr'um las byung pa'i 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa'i steng du dug gis zin pa bzhag la /

analyzed: dug gi gzi brjid ser po rnams kyis ma lus pa khyab pa la 'khor lo dkar po nyid kyi 'og nas mnan te /

analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis 'od zer dkar po gsal bar bsam pa ni dug bsal ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The assembly of its light rays is imagined to be white light rays. This is the rite for removing poison.

analyzed: dgon pa'i ba lang gi lci ba la stong phrag brgyad bzlas te /

original: dar sngon pos gtums nas tshon sna lnga'i skud pas bcings nas mchod rten chen po'i srog shing la btags nas ji srid ma grol ba de srid du ser ba bsrung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Having wrapped it in blue silk and bound it with five-colored string, one should tie it to the life-wood of a great stÅ«pa. For as long as it is not released, one will protect against hail.

analyzed: bag zan dang tsandan dmar po'i phye ma la klu'i rgyal po ba ru na'i gzungs brnyan byas te /

translated: Anoint it with neem juice, and offer a bali of boiled rice, milk, and the three sweet things three times a day.

original: gong du aom n'a ga r'a dza ba ru na ye sh'i ghram munydza ba ri sha ya da ttam sv'a h'a zhes zhag bdun gyi bar du nyin re stong phrag bcu bzlas nas gzugs brnyan klu'i mtshor bskyal na char 'bebs so //

translated: Recite the mantra of the principal deity, ending with svÄhÄ, and the mantra above, â€œOá¹ƒ, NÄgarÄja Varuá¹‡a, release, release! Give rain! SvÄhÄ!â€ a thousand times a day for seven days. If you then take the effigy to a nÄga lake, it will rain.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid la phul ba'i me tog rnying pa gar mkhan gyi khyim nas blangs pa'i mes kham phor sar pa bkang ba'i nang du bsregs nas bla gab med par brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na char 'chad par 'gyur ro //

translated: Take old flowers that were offered to the Blessed One, burn them in a fire from a dancerâ€™s house in a new clay pot, and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times in the open air. The rain will stop.

original: gro ga'am chu shing gi 'dab ma la sngags gur gum gyis bris te /
analyzed: gro ga'am chu shing gi 'dab ma la sngags gur gum gyis bris te /
translated: Write the mantra on birch bark or a leaf of the Indian cluster fig tree with saffron.

original: skar ma me bzhi la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas mgul du btags na byis pa chung du bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skar ma me bzhi la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas mgul du btags na byis pa chung du bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] eight thousand times into a fire of stars and four fires, and ties it around one's neck, one will protect a small child.

original: rma bya'i sgo'am thing ril gyi rkang la lan stong phrag gsum bzlas nas sgo khang gi rta babs sam sgo steng du btsugs nas /
analyzed: rma bya'i sgo'am thing ril gyi rkang la lan stong phrag gsum bzlas nas sgo khang gi rta babs sam sgo steng du btsugs nas /
translated: If one repeats [the mantra] three thousand times into the ear of a peacock or a mongoose, and plants it on the lintel of a door or above a door,

original: de'i 'og nas 'dzul ba'i srog chags thams cad la yams kyi nad kyis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og nas 'dzul ba'i srog chags thams cad la yams kyi nad kyis mi tshugs so //
translated: no animal that enters under it will be afflicted by epidemic disease.

original: las tshogs gzhan dag 'dir gzhung mngas kyis dogs nas ma bris so //
analyzed: las tshogs gzhan dag 'dir gzhung mngas kyis dogs nas ma bris so //
translated: Fearing that it would be too much, I have not written down the other collections of rites here.

original: las de thams cad sems @66b can thams cad la brtse ba ni kha skong gi man ngag go //
analyzed: las de thams cad sems @66b can thams cad la brtse ba ni kha skong gi man ngag go //
translated: The compassion for all sentient beings in all those rites is the supplementary instruction.

original: rtog pa'i rgyal po la brten nas //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyal po la brten nas //
translated: Relying on the king of tantras,

original: bla ma'i man ngag ji bzhin du //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag ji bzhin du //
translated: just as the guru's instructions are,

original: go rims ji bzhin bris pa las //
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin bris pa las //
translated: I have written in the proper order.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par rigs /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis bzod par rigs /
translated: The wise should understand it.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas ni //
translated: Having first performed the approach,

original: sngags 'di yis ni las rnams kun //
analyzed: sngags 'di yis ni las rnams kun //
translated: with this mantra all rites

original: brtson ldan the tshom med pa yis //
analyzed: brtson ldan the tshom med pa yis //
translated: should be performed by one who is diligent and without doubt.

original: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur 'di la the tshom med //
translated: There is no doubt about this accomplishment.

original: dam tshig gsum bkod pa'i rgyal po'i yi ge brgya ba sgrub pa'i thabs slob dpon chen po ke dha ra na dhis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum bkod pa'i rgyal po'i yi ge brgya ba sgrub pa'i thabs slob dpon chen po ke dha ra na dhis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The method of accomplishing the hundred syllables of the King of the Array of Three Commitments composed by the great master Kedarana is complete.

analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pandi ta dpal go mi 'chi med dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba blo ldan shes rab kyis bsgyur ba'o//
